review.title: Good place to stay in SF
review.reviewText: Spacious suite, very clean and tidy.  The bed was a little hard for our liking, but not too bad.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very friendly, the location is within reasonable walking distance of downtown.  Moscone Center is about a 20 minute walk.
review.negativeRemarks: There was a bit of a hard sell at checkin to get us to attend a breakfast sales pitch. Finally just stated, "not interested, I have to go now"

review.title: Overall good place to stay
review.reviewText: In a good location a few blocks from Union Square. Friendly, helpful staff and comfortable, clean rooms. Like most hotels in San Francisco though the cost is really high.
review.negativeRemarks: For the price paid, room service should be included
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square and unless you are infirm or lazy the Embarcadero, Ferry Building, Pier 39 etc are walkable

review.title: Nice clean hotel, west of Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice.  Staff was very pleasant.  However, be warned, Wyndam Resorts will attempt to see you a timeshare.  They ask you to attend a two hour presentation, where they will attempt to sell you a timeshare.  Also, because it is not a traditional hotel, there is no daily housekeeping services.  We stayed for almost of week and required a new set of towels.  The front desk was very polite, and provided us with a new set very quickly.

review.title: Nice location. Nice property.
review.reviewText: The Canterbury is in a great location, centrally located with lots of restaurants nearby.. A couple blocks walk to either the California or Powell St. cable car lines. Staff is very friendly,especially Teddy. He helped us with everything we would need for our 1 week stay and showed us where everything was in our suite. Staff quickly responded whenever we needed anything else. Overall, a terrific stay and I would recommend to anyone who was going to be staying in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Helpful staff and no hidden fees.

review.title: Nice hotel and location
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and modern. Staff was very friendly and helpful. They were slightly pushy about attending a breakfast to become Wyndham members or something of that sort. No cleaning service during our stay. I didn't mind too much, just something to note. Nice room though, it was like a condo/apartment. Nice location, 2 blocks from the cable car pickup.

review.title: Nice hôtel,very clean.
review.reviewText: Dont Forget no housekeeping at thi hôtel ,the concierge Teddy was very friendly and hopefull.

review.title: Nice hotel but very pushy sales tactics
review.reviewText: Hotel is nice and walking distance from many attractions. Valet guy nice and helpful, check in front desk person helpful, but the he sends you to concierge for your "welcome" package. That package "welcome " package consists of a list of restaurants and city core map and a concierge trying to get you to come in at 8:30 in the morning to listen to some seminar for 2 hours that will tell you about their hotels. Well, I didn't come to SanFran for that. The woman wouldn't take no for an answer. She called our room twice that night to get us to go even though we told her we were tired and wanting to get some rest. Next morning, no smiles and pleasantries any more. We didn't even get a look from that person. First and last time for Wyndham for us.

review.title: Great hotel in the heart of the city
review.reviewText: Outstanding rooms with plenty of room and a small kitchen. Staff friendly. Drawback: no food on sight. There are plenty of places in town to have a bite.

review.title: Just ask the bellhops
review.reviewText: Front desk was rude. They wouldn't even give us directions around town. Concierge just wanted us to buy a time share. Bellhops and valet were most helpful. In fact they went out of their way to be helpful. Exemplary service from them!

review.title: Easy Access to Everything
review.reviewText: The Wyndham is located in the midst of everything. We easily walked to or took public transportation to where ever we wanted to go.
review.positiveRemarks: This hotel has the most comfortable beds I have experience and that includes the sleeper sofa.
review.negativeRemarks: Unfortunately, the counter space in the bathroom was lacking.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is very near Union Square. The trolley is also nearby, but it was too crowed to ride. We took the streetcar to Fisherman's Wharf.

photos.caption: You must go to Muir Woods. Take a tour OR park in Saulato- DO NOT DRIVE THERE.
From Hotel, it's only about a 2 mile walk. And you get great views from the bridge without dealing with the crazy traffic.
A MUST! Farmers market down by the ferry landing. So many local, organic, delicious things- and tons of samples!!

review.title: Great hotel VERY close to Union Sq & China Town
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel. It's a timeshare (didn't know at booking so be prepared. ) Staff is super friendly and eager to help out. Hotel is close to 3 good restaurants (a pub, pizza place and Italian restaurant) and you get a discount for staying at the Wyndham. I booked a 1 bedroom suite- it was perfect for my family of 4 (kids 12&9) and we had plenty of room.

review.title: Great hotel with good location.
review.reviewText:
Room was lovely and very clean.  Staff very friendly and accommodating.  Location for seeing San Francisco was excellent.  
Would recommend this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: close to Union Station.  Walking distance to cable cars, Lombard Street and could walk to waterfront if energetic.  Close to places to eat and shop.

review.reviewText: Stayed at the Wyndham Canterbury San Francisco to attend my sister's Graduation. Staff was courteous to my family and I. The timeshare meeting was okay. Received breakfast, took up about two hours of my time, it was interesting but declined the timeshare. They were a little pushy. The place itself was wonderful. There is a small game room, tea/coffee in lobby. We stayed in an one bedroom with sofa bed. Our room was clean, had a sink, microwave and Fridge. We mostly ate out but heard you could borrow a small grill. The location is not that far from union square (probably 10 minutes away) and 5 or less away from Powell St, 5 minutes away from Chinatown.

When I arrived at the Wyndham Canterbury San Fransisco my family and I was greeted pleasantly. Rebekah check us in quickly want was very gracious. I definitely enjoyed dealing with her.  The staff were very polite.  They were very welcoming and helpful. We had two rooms next to get her other. Our rooms was clean, spacious and accommodated all seven people.  The place is a timeshare and we attended the the timeshare session. They were a little pushy, but understood if you decided not to purchase a timeshare. Even after declining, the staff were very sweet. I would definitely stay at this location again.

review.title: Nice hotel. Central location
review.reviewText: Great stay.  Listened to a vacation club presentation and got 3 nights free parking $95 value and breakfast

review.title: Centrally located great boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Great location for walking throughout downtown SF, good access to public transportation.

review.title: Way better then expected!
review.reviewText: Amazing spacious rooms. Updated, modern and very comfortable. Highly recommended.

review.title: great place for short stay with family
review.reviewText: Great location, cleanliness, A little to small for 2 adults and two kids but enough for a long weekend.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent diner around the corner( lori's ) and great location.

review.title: Above and Beyond Customer Satisfaction!
review.reviewText: We don't live in a perfect, but our stay at Wyndham with the staff, especially Ernesto was Stellar! Satisfaction #1!!

review.title: Great hotel.
review.reviewText:
We were very happy with our stay.  

Service was great all around.  From the front desk staff to the housekeepers.

Hotel was very clean and exactly what we needed.

Only thing that was a bit annoying was the service desk pitching the time share presentation.  I was expecting it when we booked the hotel, but wasn't  a fan of their approach.  They provide you with a "welcome package" but don't really seem interested in anything but booking you for the presentation.

Overall though loved the hotel and would stay there again.

This was my 1st time staying at Wyndham Canterbury.  
Overall, it beat my expectation. For improvement, it would be great if there was a free bottle of water in the room everyday.
review.negativeRemarks: 1 free bottle of water per day

review.title: Lovely hotel but we were always cold
review.reviewText: This hotel is beautiful and centrally located. All the staff were friendly and accommodating. We could walk to restaurants. We even took a short brisk walk yo Chinatown. Our room itself was quite spacious and we enjoyed having a full kitchen available to us. But... the thermostat could not be controlled properly (even by the technician who came when we complained about it). We were there for three nights and we were freezing every night because the vents were blowing cold air full force. My husband had to close them himself to help with the situation. Other than this situation we were pleased with everything else about this hotel.

photos.caption: Living room with queen size sofa bed

review.title: Very nice, walk to Union Square
review.reviewText: Very clean, updated room with very nice amenities. One of the best hotels I have visited for the price. 3 star rated room but feels like 4 or better. Reasonable valet parking rate and free wifi too! Had an awesome time. Yes, I will recommend you to my friends. And, I will probably come back!!!

review.title: Wonderful, Refurbished, Quiet Hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel was located in an ideal location.  In Union Square district, close to all shopping, restaurants, pubs etc.  We stayed in room 303, which was a one bedroom suite and had ample room.  Comfortable sofa bed and lovely linens.  Great walk in shower, and fantastic black out drapery.
review.negativeRemarks: The price of overnight parking was high, but appears that this is the norm in San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: Great little café close by, "Honey Honey" and also a quaint little pub on the corner....Shopping was only blocks away, i.e. Macy's, Nordstom's, DSW

review.title: Great hotel right downtown
review.reviewText: Recently stayed in one of  their suites, it was fantastic!  We were 3 adults and 2 young children with more than enough room.  Hotel staff were very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. The  hotel is located  right downtown- 1 block from the Hop on Hop off bus stop, close to great restaurants and shopping.
review.positiveRemarks: Great rate, close to everything we wanted to see/do.  Clean and nicely decorated.

review.title: Mixed review
review.reviewText: Room was very nice, but we were quite surprised that daily housekeeping was not provided.  Nor was there any sort of continental breakfast available.  Additionally, upon checking in, we were immediately directed to the concierge who was quite helpful until she starting pushing a breakfast meeting, the purpose of which seemed to be promoting some sort of time-share.  Is this a Wyndham thing?

review.title: Wonderful place to stay!
review.reviewText: Great accommodations for the price and location.  Having a suite with a almost full kitchen was really nice. Even laundry facilities were available.  Family friendly with very nice staff. Loved it. Very happy with our stay there.
Most pleasurable: helpful staff, everything so clean.

review.title: Close to shopping, mass transit and restaurants
review.reviewText: Had an excellent experience at the Wyndham.  Our room was recently renovated, which was very well done.  We had plenty of room, a surprisingly large bathroom (it was handicap accessible, which was not requested, though we certainly enjoyed having that much room).  The kitchen was very well equipped, one of the best I've seen.  The location is just off of Union Square, thus shopping and restaurants were easily accessible, as is mass transportation.  The staff was great, from the concierge, who helped us often, to housekeeping, who were friendly and quick.  All in all, a great vacation with a great place to stay!
review.negativeRemarks: More counter and/or storage space in the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: It's right off of Union Square, thus LOTS of shopping and restaurants and very easy access to mass transportation, including the cable cars.

review.reviewText: great experience at this hotel and good traveler location.

review.title: Nice stay in SF
review.reviewText: The room is spacious. Walking distance to Union Sq and China town. The staff would try to sell you the time share during your stay but you do not have to feel obligated.

review.title: Beautiful clean hotel
review.reviewText: Convenient to union square used uber regularly went to fishermans wharf izzys and umami restaurants

review.title: Not yet ready for business travellers
review.reviewText:
1. I did not like the experience of dealing with the Expedia person who assisted with the reservation.
2. It was annoying to learn only while checking out that this is a time share "hotel".  No one told me.
3. The WIFI was slow, and unreliable, cutting out from time to time.  Also, when it tried to upgrade to the offered higher speed WIFI, it was quite an ordeal that took about 90 minutes and a call to the help line at your WIFI vendor. BTW, you might try the user interface for that sign up - it exasperatingly erases all one's data entries if a single one of them is incorrect (eg if you generate an unacceptable password)
4. The "Business Center" has two PCs that are excruciatingly slow, and a printer as well that lumbers along. Old, slow, out of date. 
5. The single bright light in this business experience is that the staff were unfailingly polite and did their best to help. I give them credit for trying, and for being nice to me.

review.title: Very comfortable, excellent for the price
review.reviewText: I really liked this hotel.  There's no maid service or restaurant.  But you have a kitchenette and a small dining and living area in addition to the small bedroom, and it's remarkably quiet (my room was toward the back of the building).  It's also convenient to Union Square.
review.positiveRemarks: Plenty of space for one person, should be okay for two; kitchenette; pleasantly decorated
review.negativeRemarks: Ran out of hot water a couple of times, they may need a larger water heater
review.locationRemarks: A few blocks from Union Square

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText: Wyndham Canterbury is clean, has nice décor, and all the convenience you want -- free wifi, small, but functional work-out room, and kitchenette complete with microwave, fridge and even wine glasses! I would definitely stay here again for my next conference.
The room was lovely, comfortable and clean. The concierge did try to sell is membership or timeshare or something

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Great location, very clean and modern, huge rooms, comfortable beds and sofas.

Only thing is staff not so friendly and I didn't know it was a timeshare/vacation rental and they wanted to do their pitch which I declined. Also wifi very slow.

Otherwise, very pleasant stay.

But overall nice place to stay.

review.title: Great Location, Great Hotel!
review.reviewText:
Our group of four stayed in a one bedroom unit, utilizing the sofa bed.

Even though our sofa bed was not very comfortable, I gave this review a 5 because the goods so compensated for that one bad.

-we were on the street side, and there was a bit of noise at night, sirens from time to time, etc., but we didn't find it too noisy and it didn't keep us up.
- we got a skillet, which we asked for right away and were lucky to get one as there isn't enough for one for every room. We had every breakfast in room and saved a lot of time and money doing this.
- the rooms are very nice, very we'll equipped and very clean
- the lobby is really nice, and everyone is very helpful. Coffee is out in the morning, infused water and iced tea through the day, cookies at one point
- whenever we asked for something we got it right away, service is impeccable. I.e. Skillet, extra towels, change of towels, wake up call, toilet paper...very, very good service
- staff and security are all very, very helpful and friendly, helped to get to airport, answer touristy questions...everything they did was professional, and courteous.
- the bed in the bedroom was very comfortable
- bathroom was shower only, very spacious. Extras included a hair dryer and a mirror that could be moved to another room for makeup (four girls)...also a full mirror in the bedroom.
- lots of room for clothing storage between dressers, night stands plus two closets.
I would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Our room was really spacious, and much, much larger than any hotel that I considered.
review.locationRemarks: The location couldn't be beat. Close enough to walk to union square, and bus route to anywhere is really close.

review.title: We enjoyed the stay
review.reviewText: Very nice staff and location. Loved the Japanese restaurant and the Sutter Pub nearby.

review.title: LOVED IT! The staff was exceptional
review.reviewText: The overall experience of this resort was EXCELLENT. I travel to SF for business at least twice a month - I wish I could stay here each visit. It felt like home. It had all the comforts of home. The size of the room was exceptional compared to other hotels in the area. I will defiantly try to get in again, I was spoiled. The only downside is that this is a timeshare and they do try to sell you hard on investing into the vacation packages. Nice, friendly staff not too pushy with the sales pitch. Loved it!
review.positiveRemarks: The size of the room. The amenities.
review.negativeRemarks: I wish there were a restaurant on site. Then I would have no reason to leave - other than work of course!
review.locationRemarks: Cute little Pub less than one block away. Japanese restaurant two doors away. Neighborhood coffee house 2 blocks away and quaint organic restaurant.

review.reviewText: This hotel is well situated. It is very close to union square and all modes of transportation including the BART to/from SFO. As noted in the other reviews, it is really not a hotel but more like a time share/condo facility. The rooms and facilities were updated and very clean. And, there was access to a laundry machine on our floor - free of charge - which was great for our family. We enjoyed our stay and would stay again.

review.title: Perfect location, great for families
review.reviewText: Stayed here for a week with the family. Staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Rooms look brand new and well sized for families.
review.positiveRemarks: Free wifi and laundry facilities were great!
review.negativeRemarks: There is no daily maid service which was the only downside
review.locationRemarks: Two blocks from union square - great for shopping and restaurants

review.title: December conference stay
review.reviewText: Overall pleasant experience. The staff was quite friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious and relatively well maintained with all necessary kitchen ammenities...including coffee. Clean. Decent fitness center with 6 or 7 aerobic machines.
review.locationRemarks: Great location...4 blocks to Union square

review.reviewText: Vacation marketing staff had little respect for privacy - we were repeatably asked to attend a marketing pitch, having to decline each time. After the third time it became very annoying having to keep justifying why we were not interested. If a guest declines, staff should have respect and leave it at that - not continue to try and pressure people (I don't care to sit through a 2-3 hour seminar, even if I get $100).

review.title: nice hotel in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText:
For the money that you paid in Expedia, this is a great deal. It is in an excellent location, one mile walking from the financial district. There are a lot of nice and small restaurant within one block or the same block where the hotel is located. The room was a decent size, with one bedroom, a small living room and dining room. The couch on the living room converts into a bed. Which is pretty convenient. There is small refrigerator and microwave. It also has free wi-fi. They have parking for a reasonable daily rate.

I was there for a training in the financial district. I love it that I didn't have to drive, nor take a bus or taxi.
review.positiveRemarks: I love this hotel; great location. And love the boutique restaurants nearby.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco, has an aquarium, you are really close to Fisherman Wharf. There are a lot of very neat thing to do in a city like SF.

review.title: Hotel Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the 5 day stay. Although after checking in was ushered to the Timeshare receptionist who just informed me I was going to a 1 hour presentation during my stay so they could sales pitch me to sign up to the program. I did attend because I was interested in hearing about it but also the brunch and gift card for attending was good payment for my time. Other than this interruption to my planned holiday the staff were pleasant and helpful and the facility was in great shape.
review.positiveRemarks: Good room with modern style amenities. spacious 1 bedroom apartment with kitchenette well furnished. and the free wifi was at good strength.
review.locationRemarks: short walk to union square to catch the cable car to Fisherman's Wharf. But get MUNI multi day pass for travel much cheaper than single rides.

review.title: Very good hotel, exceeded our expectations.
review.reviewText: The hotel had everything we required as a family travelling. The room actually looked better in real life than it did in the photos. And there were free laundry facilities which was very helpful with young children. We were asked initially if we would like to go to the breakfast to find out more about the timeshare apartments which was a little pressurised but after that the staff were really helpful and extremely polite and friendly. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Nice place to stay near Union Square.
review.reviewText: room was extremely comfortable for the four of us. Extremely quiet! We barely knew there was anyone else in the hotel. Street noise was a minimum also. We do wish we could have gotten a king bed, my husband and I are not used to sleeping on a queen size.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the decor in lobby and also rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: We stayed in a handicapped room with a larger shower. Where curtain touched the floor it was full of mold. The room seemed very dusty also.
review.locationRemarks: Absolute great location. I used to live downtown and enjoyed being there again. Short walk to many attractions.

review.title: City hotel
review.reviewText: There was no daily maid service, sundry shop or on-site restaurant. But the absence of maid service was the biggest disappointment.

review.title: Good value, but with a few quirks.
review.reviewText: The Canterbury looks to be a newly renovated hotel/timeshare in a good location for most SF attractions. The staff are pleasant enough; however, the faux concierge (really a timeshare salesperson) made the initial arrival more stressful than necessary. The valet service was also a bit confusing, as it seemed like the contracted valets only worked certain hours - requiring other hotel staff to fill the gaps at other times. Otherwise, the room was clean, albeit a bit small and close to the elevator (noisy at night). Perhaps timeshare owners are assigned better rooms. Great workout facility with few takers.
review.positiveRemarks:
Good value
Relatively good location
Clean, new rooms
review.negativeRemarks:
Timeshare sales pitch at arrival
Confusing valet system
review.locationRemarks: Sort of on the fringe of Nob Hill and the Tenderloin (Tendernob). Located a couple of blocks beyond the other larger hotels.

review.title: Enjoyed it
review.reviewText: Very convenient location if you want to be in downtown

review.title: Not the beat place
review.reviewText: Don't clean rooms daily only every 4 days, saw a single flea. Wanted a cab to go to dinner bellman sent me to consigned and consiegne sent me back to bellman so I walked

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived the staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was way above our expectations would def come back here again.

review.title: Great apartment in San Fran
review.reviewText: My sister and I stayed here in September. The location is fantastic - while some other reviews said that there were interesting characters at night - that is just San Francisco - the location of the hotel is in a safe area and a good block or so away from the Tenderloin which is a little less desirable. The only thing stopping 5 stars all round is the taste of the water in the kitchen - strange I know but it tasted quite chlorinated, something we did not come across in our travels elsewhere in California, or even in San Francisco. Other than that, the room sizes are great, very well fitted out and the kitchen facilities are great. I would definitely stay again.

review.title: Nice Place - Give It A Try!
review.reviewText:
Bellman went the extra step to retrieve something for me from the trunk of my car after it had been parked.

Staff recommended a bus tour that was wonderful and took us to places I had not seen before in many visits to San Francisco.

The unit was a bit smaller than I what I was expecting but certainly not too small and liveable. Great location. Very walkable to many sights.

I was very leary of the 'update meeting' based on past experiences with other places and reviews I had read of this location. I politely refused and that was the end of it. No hassle.
review.positiveRemarks: Attentive staff. Unit very modern and updated.
review.negativeRemarks: Extra step to speak with someone after check-in (Positioned as a 'welcome' but really a pitch about the 'update' meeting.)
review.locationRemarks: Wonderful location. Very near and central to many activities

review.title: Another good time.
review.reviewText: This is our second visit to the Wyndham Canterbury. This trip was a short family vacation. Our 9 yr and 6 yr gave this place a 10. They liked the kitchenette. They were able to have breakfast when they wanted. We had a short walk to the Trolley and could catch the Muni easily. They felt safe walking in the evening. The staff were pleasant and helpful. We will definitely return.

review.title: This hotel should never get a bad rap....
review.reviewText: I stayed 2 nights....found the hotel staff to be extremely professional and accomodating. This is a comfortable bed & breakfast with character, disguised as a hotel. Great location, only a few blocks off of Powell Street. Shopping and dining options are plentiful. Don't expect major chain amenities....but for the price and location, this is a safe choice. The popcorn they make nightly in the bar is an enjoyable treat.

review.title: cozy with view
review.reviewText: good location, very attractive cozy room, although the bath was very small.  We had a fabulous view for an amazing low price.

review.title: OK - Not Great
review.reviewText: Bathroom was very small. Toilet was right next to tub. Parking  to costly

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: Good location,close to Union Square, bus stop outside of the hotel.  Our room was shabby: holes in bedspread, dirty upholstery on the furniture, dirty glassware, small bathroom.

review.title: Good Location, Poor Quality
review.reviewText: Although this hotel is in a good location just a few blocks from major shopping (Macys, Williams Sonoma,etc.), overall we were disappointed in the quality of the facilities. Although tastefully decorated, the room was small and the bedspreads and mattresses were worn.  In addition the bathroom was tiny with little surface space for toiletries. The atrium restaurant service was slow although the food was fairly good.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel was very dated without being charming. Rooms were small and bland.

review.title: Canterbury
review.reviewText: The service was good, the room moderately appointed and clean.  The housekeeping service was fine.  The bath stool did not have enough room between the stool and the tub which makes it difficult for tall people.

review.title: Plucked out of London!
review.reviewText: While the lobby wasn't as "shiny" as the Expedia picture indicated it was very appropriate to the hotel.  My immediate impression was "plucked out of London" and I am serious when I report that not one voice (barring the staff) was other than British.  Apparently many British tours book there and it made for a delightful background experience.  Breakfast buffet excellent (if a little expensive, but I looked at the convenience on a busy day) Greenhouse restaurant pretty but I didn't eat there.  One peculiar item... the ice machine is on the lobby level, so don't don night clothes before obtaining ice!  Neighborhood safe and busy at night.  Bedroom window opens and great city view.  Only one night was there any noise problem and that was the garbage truck.  Very convenient to the fabulous public transportation system. Around the corner from the Sir Francis Drake Hotel.  I have already recommended to others and will stay there again.

review.title: Good Place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
It's a nice hotel, and is in a good spot.
Service is  Good and the restaurant is great.

review.title: Don't understand "Review Title".
review.reviewText: Only one OLD ice machine for the hotel. Located off lobby. Very inconvient if you were on an upper floor. Location to shopping, Chinatown and Fisherman's Wharf excellent.
